_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:20:41 using v2.1
title: Did people feel they were treated with respect and dignity?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of people who felt they had been treated with dignity and respect is the most positive result of the questions included here. The survey reported 98% of people in every year felt they were treated with dignity and respect either 'definitely' or 'to some extent'. The proportion who felt they had definitely been treated with dignity and respect has decreased by 2% from 2010 to 2013, however it still remains high at 86% in 2013.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
